`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"Now that we understand prime numbers, how can we determine if a number is prime or not? `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"A Deterministic algorithm can determine whether a number is prime or not with absolute certainty. But the probabilistic algorithms tell us where a number is probable prime or composite. Probabilistic primilarity tests can't determine a prime with absolute certainty, but it works most of the time. A composite number which passes through a probabilistic test is called a psuedo prime."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/naimul/Workspace/Personal/naimulhaque.com/content/blog/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-52e7d558-18c4-4205-be13-4cc96d972d71.mdx",lineNumber:14,columnNumber:1},this),`
